revised_title: Observations on the Structure and Function of Stomachs in Different Animals
tldr: The author examines the internal structure of stomachs in various animals to understand the process of converting animal and vegetable substances into chyle. They describe the different structures and functions of stomachs in ruminating and non-ruminating animals, providing insights into the digestive processes and the role of the stomach in digestion. The study highlights the importance of examining stomachs in a recent state after death to accurately observe their internal structures and functions.
